com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2

Class CharacterGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.CharacterGame

  • public class CharacterGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the core of the program, it allocates characters into an array on start up then interacts with a user who can select characters (by array index) to run a combat simulation.
    Since:
    javac 1.8.0_271
    Author:
    Piedas, modified by Daniel Pereira Castillo Student number: 041009960 Lab Section 302
    See Also:
    Program

      Maximum size of the array storing references to characters

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CharacterGame()
      Initializes the array of character references with a new character for each element within the characters array.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_ARRAY_SIZE

        private static final int MAX_ARRAY_SIZE
        Maximum size of the array storing references to characters
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • characters

        private Character[] characters
        Array storing references to characters, it is assumed that this array will always be 'full' i.e. no null values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CharacterGame

        public CharacterGame()
        Initializes the array of character references with a new character for each element within the characters array. Using nested for loops, an instance of SeaMonster is made for every instance of MutantEagle, and then added to the characters array.

    • Method Detail

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        This is the core logic of the program, it
        • displays the characters available
        • asks the user to enter two index values
        • calls method fight to process the combat match
        • heals all of the characters to full health after the combat
        • prompts the user if they want to run another fight-match (Y/N)

      • fight

        private void fight(int index1,
                   int index2)
        this method examines the indexes for the two characters to verify that:
        • the indexes are not the same, i.e. cannot fight itself
        • the indexes are within bounds of the array indexes
        • copies the references from the indexed array elements and calls method conductFight(Character,Character)
        Parameters:
        index1 - array index of first selected character
        index2 - array index of second selected character

      • conductFight

        private void conductFight(Character combatant1,
                          Character combatant2)
        This method uses a loop to conduct a combat match, i.e. fight, between two characters. The loop procedurally has combatant1 attack combatant2, and combatant2 then attack combatant2. It then reports the results to the screen. The loop stops either when one of the combatant has health at or below zero, or after 100 rounds of combat as a sanity-check so the program does not run forever.
        Parameters:
        combatant1 - The first combatant
        combatant2 - The second combatant

      • reportCombat

        private java.lang.String reportCombat(Character combatant,
                                      Attack attack,
                                      AttackReport report)
        This method generates a report on how a character performed, with the combatant details, what attack they generated, how they defended.
        Parameters:
        combatant - The combatant
        attack - The attack made by the combatant
        report - The attack defended against by the combatant
        Returns:
        A String with combatant details, the attack, and attack report

      • isCombatEndedCharacterDeath

        private boolean isCombatEndedCharacterDeath(Character combatant1,
                                            Character combatant2)
        This method checks the current health of the two Characters and returns true if either once has current health less than or equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        combatant1 - The first combatant
        combatant2 - The second combatant
        Returns:
        true if either combatant has zero or less health

      • reportWinLoose

        private java.lang.String reportWinLoose(Character combatant1,
                                        Character combatant2)
        This method accepts two Characters, and based on their current health determines who won, who lost, or if a fight was a draw (i.e. both characters are living). This method assumes that the fighting is over.
        Parameters:
        combatant1 - The first combatant
        combatant2 - The second combatant
        Returns:
        report on fight outcome, based on the combatant's current health

      • reportEndingState

        private java.lang.String reportEndingState(Character combatant1,
                                           Character combatant2)
        This method simply generates a report based on the statistics of the two characters passed, calling toString() on each.
        Parameters:
        combatant1 - The first combatant
        combatant2 - The second combatant
        Returns:
        A report based on calling toString() on each Character

      • reportEndOfMatch

        private java.lang.String reportEndOfMatch(Character combatant1,
                                          Character combatant2)
        This method generates a report suitable for display after a fight has concluded, it includes the fight outcome (winner, looser, draw), as well as each Character's state.
        Parameters:
        combatant1 - The first combatant
        combatant2 - The second combatant
        Returns:
        report on fight outcome, and each Character's state.
